text: Joseph Conrad said, "The belief in a supernatural source of evil is not necessary. Men alone are quite capable of every wickedness."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Joseph Conrad

text: Emerson said, "All is riddle, and the key to a riddle is another riddle."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Winston Churchill said, "The farther backward you can look, the farther forward you will see."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Winston Churchill

text: Nietzsche once said, "When you look long into an abyss, the abyss looks into you."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: Faulkner once said, "Don't bother just to be better than your contemporaries or predecessors. Try to be better than yourself."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: William Faulkner

text: James Reese once said, "There are certain clues at a crime scene which, by their very nature, do not lend themselves to being collected or examined. How does one collect love, rage, hatred, fear...? These are things that we're trained to look for."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: James Reese

text: Einstein once said, "Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited; imagination encircles the world."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Albert Einstein

text: Samuel Johnson wrote, "Almost all absurdity of conduct arises from the imitation of those who we cannot resemble."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Samuel Johnson

text: French poet Jacques Rigaut said, "Don't forget that I cannot see myself, that my role is limited to being the one who looks in the mirror."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Jacques Rigaut

text: Rose Kennedy once said, "Birds sing after a storm; why shouldn't people feel as free to delight in whatever sunlight remains to them?"
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Rose Kennedy

text: Euripides said, "When a good man is hurt, all who would be called good must suffer with him."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Euripides

text: Euripides said, "When love is in excess it brings a man no honor nor worthiness."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Euripides

text: Nietzsche wrote, "The irrationality of a thing is not an argument against its existence, rather a condition of it."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: Shakespeare wrote, "Nothing is so common as the wish to be remarkable."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner
author: William Shakespeare

text: Dr. Thomas Fuller – "With foxes we must play the fox."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Dr. Thomas Fuller

text: Hemingway wrote, "There is no hunting like the hunting of man; and those who have hunted armed men long enough and liked it never really care for anything else."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Ernest Hemingway

text: Carl Jung said, "The healthy man does not torture others. Generally, it is the tortured who turn into torturers."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Carl Jung

text: Robert Oxton Bolt once wrote, "A belief is not merely an idea the mind possesses; it is an idea that possesses the mind."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Robert Oxton Bolt

text: Albert Einstein asked, "The question that sometimes drives me hazy: Am I or the others crazy?"
speaker: Spencer Reid
author: Albert Einstein

text: Sir Peter Ustinov said, "Unfortunately, a super abundance of dreams is paid for by a growing potential for nightmares."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Sir Peter Ustinov

text: Playwright Eugene Ionesco said, "Ideology separates us. Dreams and anguish bring us together."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Eugene Ionesco

text: Harriet Beecher Stowe once said "The bitterest tears shed over graves are for words left unsaid and deeds left undone."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

text: The poet, W. H. Auden wrote, 'Evil is unspectacular, and always human, and shares our bed and eats at our table.'
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: W. H. Auden

text: "Measure not the work until the day's out and the labor done."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

text: Roman philosopher Lucretius said, "What is food to one, is to others bitter poison."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Lucretius

text: "Whoso sheddeth man's blood, by man shall his blood be shed." Genesis 9:6.
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Genesis 9:6

text: Albert Pine said, "What we do for ourselves dies with us. What we do for others and the world remains and is immortal."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Albert Pine

text: Norman Maclean wrote, "It is those we live with and love and should know who elude us."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Norman Maclean

text: Abraham Lincoln once said, "In the end it's not the years in your life that count. It's the life in your years."
speaker: Elle Greenaway
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Nietzsche wrote, "The individual has always had to struggle to keep from being overwhelmed by the tribe."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: W. H. Auden said, "Murder is unique in that it abolishes the party it injures, so that society must take the place of the victim and on his behalf demand atonement or grant forgiveness."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: W. H. Auden

text: Gandhi said, "Better to be violent if there's violence in our hearts than to put on the cloak of non-violence to cover impotence."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Gandhi also said, "I object to violence because when it appears to do good, the good is only temporary. The evil it does is permanent."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Diane Arbus once said, "A photograph is a secret about a secret. The more it tells you, the less you know."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Diane Arbus

text: Bernard Shaw once said, "An American has no sense of privacy. He does not know what it means. There is no such thing in the country."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Bernard Shaw

text: Anthony Brandt wrote, "Other things may change us, but we start and end with family."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner
author: Anthony Brandt

text: Mexican proverb: "The house does not rest on the ground, but upon a woman."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner
author: Mexican proverb

text: The French philosopher Voltaire wrote, "There are some that only employ words for the purpose of disguising their thoughts."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Voltaire

text: The author François de la Rochefoucauld wrote, "We are so accustomed to disguise ourselves to others that in the end we become disguised to ourselves."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: François de la Rochefoucauld

text: Albert Einstein said, "Whoever undertakes to set himself up as judge in the field of truth and knowledge is shipwrecked by the laughter of the gods."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Albert Einstein

text: George Orwell said, "In a time of universal deceit, telling the truth is a revolutionary act."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: George Orwell

text: Writer Elbert Hubbard said, "No man needs a vacation so much as the man who has just had one."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: "The defects and faults of the mind are like wounds in the body; after all imaginable care has been taken to heal them up, still there will be a scar left behind."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: François de la Rochefoucauld

text: "It has been said, 'time heals all wounds.' I do not agree. The wounds remain. In time, the mind, protecting its sanity, covers them with scar tissue and the pain lessens. But it is never gone."
speaker: Spencer Reid
author: Rose Kennedy

text: "The test of the morality of a society is what it does for its children."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Dietrich Bonhoeffer

text: "Of all the animals, man is the only one that is cruel. He is the only one that inflicts pain for the pleasure of doing it."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Mark Twain

text: "Out of suffering have emerged the strongest souls; the most massive characters are seared with scars."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: "Man is least himself when he talks in his own person. Give him a mask, and he will tell you the truth."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner
author: Oscar Wilde

text: "The basis of shame is not some personal mistake of ours, but that this humiliation is seen by everyone."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner
author: Milan Kundera

text: "Although the world is full of suffering, it is full also of the overcoming of it."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Helen Keller

text: "We can easily forgive a child who is afraid of the dark; the real tragedy of life is when men are afraid of the light."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner
author: Plato

text: "It's not so important who starts the game, but who finishes it."
speaker: JJ
author: John Wooden

text: "The ultimate choice for a man, in as much as he is driven to transcend himself, is to create or to destroy, to love or to hate."
speaker: JJ
author: Erich Fromm

text: "Crime butchers innocence to secure a prize, and innocence struggles with all its might against the attempts of crime."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Robespierre

text: "If men could only know each other, they would never either idolize or hate."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: "All through history, there have been tyrants and murderers, and for a time they can seem invincible, but in the end they always fall, always."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: "Some of the best lessons are learned from past mistakes. The error of the past is the wisdom of the future."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Dale Turner

text: "In order to learn the important lessons in life, one must, each day, surmount a fear."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: "Between the idea and the reality, between the motion and the act, falls the shadow."
speaker: Spencer Reid
author: T.S. Eliot

text: "Between the desire and the spasm, between the potency and the existence, between the essence and the descent, falls the shadow. This is the way the world ends."
speaker: Spencer Reid
author: T.S. Eliot

text: "All secrets are deep. All secrets become dark. That's in the nature of secrets."
speaker: Derek Morgan
author: Cory Doctorow

text: "Evil brings men together."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Aristotle

text: "I didn't have anything against them and they never did anything wrong to me, the way other people have all my life. Maybe they're just the ones who have to pay for it."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Perry Smith

text: "There is not a righteous man on earth who does what is right and never sins."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner
author: Ecclesiastes 7:20

text: "From the deepest desires often come the deadliest hate."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Socrates

text: "The life of the dead is placed in the memory of the living."
speaker: Spencer Reid
author: Cicero

text: "Our life is made by the death of others."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: "If there must be trouble, let it be in my day, that my child may have peace."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner
author: Thomas Paine

text: "Tragedy is a tool for the living to gain wisdom, not a guide by which to live."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Robert Kennedy

text: "The torture of a bad conscience is the hell of a living soul."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner
author: John Calvin

text: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow, learn as if you were to live forever."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: "There can be no good without evil."
speaker: Emily Prentiss
author: Russian proverb

text: "Happy families are all alike. Every unhappy family is unhappy in its own way."
speaker: Emily Prentiss
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: "One man's wilderness is another man's theme park."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Unknown

text: "Wild animals never kill for sport. Man is the only one to whom the torture and death of his fellow creatures is amusing in itself."
speaker: Emily Prentiss
author: James Anthony Froude

text: "Of all the preposterous assumptions of humanity, nothing exceeds the criticisms made of the habits of the poor by the well-housed, well-warmed, and well-fed."
speaker: Aaron Hotchner
author: Herman Melville

text: "Nothing is permanent in this wicked world— not even our troubles."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Charles Chaplin

text: "I choose my friends for their good looks, my acquaintances for their good characters, and my enemies for their good intellect."
speaker: Jason Gideon
author: Oscar Wilde

episode.name: No way out 2: The Evilution of Frank
